title: Ian Allison's Giant Sam Bankman-Fried Scoop Won Accolades in 2023
description: The CoinDesk reporter belongs in the journalism hall of fame since there's little, if any, precedent for the waves his story on Alameda Research and FTX stirred up.

title: Julia Leung: Positioning Hong Kong as a Crypto Hub
description: A former journalist, Leung is the world's most powerful female financial regulator in an increasingly important center for crypto.

title: Martin Köppelmann Is Fighting to Keep Crypto Tech on Track
description: In addition to building some of the biggest blockchain tools on Ethereum, Köppelmann is also ringing the alarm bell on how certain technology has caused the network to stray from its ideals.

title: Elizabeth Warren: D.C.’s Crypto Critic-in-Chief
description: The U.S. Senator from Massachusetts is skeptical of crypto. It's a position she leaned into in 2023.

title: Barry Silbert Navigated Fallout From 2022's Crypto Scandals
description: The former owner of CoinDesk faced a slew of lawsuits and complications in 2023, but, by year-end, his Digital Currency Group (DCG) had put some issues behind it.

title: Ron Faris at Nike Is Running With Web3
description: As many corporations shied away from blockchain-powered initiatives this year, the shoemaker has been quietly building a model for how brands can use a Web3 backend to win new audiences.

title: Caroline Pham: Supportive Regulation at the CFTC
description: The CFTC commissioner, in a year marked by an aggressive, sometimes arbitrary regulatory enforcement, stood out as an accommodator of innovation in the crypto sector.

title: Antonio Juliano: Uprooting a Successful Exchange to Explore the Cosmos
description: Juliano's dYdX switched from Ethereum to Cosmos in one of the year's biggest blockchain defections. The project has big plans for 2024.

title: Shytoshi Kusama and the SHIB community Proved that ‘Meme Coins’ Are No Joke
description: With the launch of Shibarium this year, Shytoshi Kusama and the SHIB community have established themselves as a force to be reckoned with in DeFi and Web3.

title: Luca Schnetzler: When NFTs Crashed, He Led Pudgy Penguins to Success
description: While much of the NFT market was taking beatings, the Pudgy Penguins CEO drove his brand forward, setting up shop with some of the largest retail stores in the country.

title: Ravi Menon: Singapore's Middle Way Regulator
description: Singapore's central bank head has steered a path between Hong Kong's embrace of crypto and India's stifling of it.

title: 'Pacman' Gobbled NFT Sales With Blur
description: Blur upended OpenSea's NFT marketplace dominance by focusing on big traders. Its cofounder, Pacman, who doxxed himself to face its burgeoning community, earns a spot on the Most Influential 2023.

title: Hayden Adams: From Ethereum Idealist to Business Realist at Uniswap
description: Uniswap, the first decentralized crypto exchange of its kind, was Adams' first and greatest contribution to Ethereum. The latest V4, inviting praise and criticism, earns him a spot on the Most Influential 2023.

title: Richard Teng: Steering Binance in a New Era of Compliance
description: With Binance founder Changpeng "CZ" Zhao gone, the new CEO has big shoes to fill as he's tasked with cleaning up the reputation of the world's largest crypto exchange.

title: South Africa’s crypto market shakes up as FSCA reviews dozens of license applications
description: The Financial Sector Conduct Authority (FSCA) of South Africa is making significant strides in regulating the burgeoning cryptocurrency market. As of November 30, 2023, the FSCA has received 128 applications from crypto asset service providers (CASPs), signaling a growing interest in the sector. The regulator’s approach is methodical and stringent, focusing on ensuring robust operational ... Read more

title: Bitcoin secures dominance as institutional traders lead accumulation
description: Institutional traders have significantly increased their holdings of Bitcoin (BTC) during the first three quarters of 2023, nearly doubling their assets in the largest cryptocurrency. This substantial surge in Bitcoin holdings is attributed to positive market sentiment and heightened anticipation surrounding the approval of a spot BTC exchange-traded fund (ETF) by the U.S. Securities and ... Read more

title: Attorney John E. Deaton discloses cryptocurrency portfolio preferences
description: In a recent revelation, attorney John E. Deaton, known for his involvement in the Ripple vs. SEC case, has shed light on his cryptocurrency investment preferences. Contrary to popular belief, Deaton’s portfolio leans more towards Bitcoin (BTC) and Ethereum (ETH) than XRP. This disclosure comes as a surprise to many, given his vocal support for ... Read more

title: Societe Generale issues €10m in digital green bond on Ethereum
description: French multinational financial conglomerate Societe Generale has issued its first digital green bond on a blockchain network. According to a Reuters report, the Paris-headquartered banking group has nearly $11 million worth of senior preferred unsecured bonds with maturity of three…

title: South Korean regulators call for public reports on unlicensed crypto exchanges
description: Financial authorities in South Korea have established a period for users to report any unlicensed cryptocurrency exchanges operating within the country. According to the Dec. 4 update, this latest initiative is a collaborative effort between the Digital Asset Exchange Association…

title: Altcoins Are Waking Up Following Growth In Bitcoin Fundamentals
description:
Austin Arnold, an Altcoin Daily YouTube channel presenter, has spotted fundamental growth in the Bitcoin market. Amid a recent rally that saw the flagship crypto climb above $40,000 for the first time since April 2022, the presenter noted that the total Bitcoin addresses surpassed 50 million for the first time, coinciding with the liquidation of […]

The post Altcoins Are Waking Up Following Growth In Bitcoin Fundamentals appeared first on Coin Edition.

title: Bitfinex Alpha | Bitcoin Surges and Underlying Economy Looks Solid Too
description:
In this week’s Bitfinex Alpha, we explore how Bitcoin reached a new year-to-date high of over $42,000 on December 4th and its strongest monthly close since March 2022. We attribute this surge to a culmination of various factors, including a notable shift in the dynamics...

The post Bitfinex Alpha | Bitcoin Surges and Underlying Economy Looks Solid Too appeared first on Bitfinex blog.
